gravity
Interface Component

All Known Subinterfaces:
ProxyableComponent
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultComponent
public interface Component

The component is the central concept of the framework around which everything else revolves. A component is the entity that can be configured by the container. A component is simply an object that has an interface, an implementation and a state.

Every component has a unique identity typically comprised of the interface and a type (any String) and there will be only one object of each component (a flyweight).

The Component is also a factory for component instances just like Class. The identity of the component instances (not to be confused with the component identity) is dependent on the state of the component.

Version:

Harish Krishnaswamy

Method Detail

registerImplementation

public void registerImplementation(java.lang.Class compClass,
                                   java.lang.Object[] compCtorArgs,
                                   java.util.Map compSetrArgs)
This method should be used to register an implementation for this component.

Parameters:
compClass - Component implementation class.
compCtorArgs - Component constructor arguments. This is simply an array of the constructor argument values that will be used in the order it is provided.
compSetrArgs - Component setter arguments. This is a map of the implementation property names and their values.

setRegistrationLocation

public void setRegistrationLocation(Location location)
This method may be used to register the location of the component registration. The sole purpose of this method is to provide error messages with precise location information in the event of an error.

getInstance

public java.lang.Object getInstance()
This method will return an instance (concrete or hollow) of this component. The component instance indentity is dependent on the state of the component.

Only the following is true of the returned component instance:

  • The returned component instance will be of the registered component interface type.
  • Method invocations on the returned component instance will be completed successfully provided an implementation was registered prior to the method invocation.

    The advantage of using this method is that an instance of the component may be obtained even prior to registering an implementation for the component.

    • setRetrievalLocation

    public void setRetrievalLocation(Location location)
    This method may be used to register the location of the component retrieval. The sole purpose of this method is to provide error messages with precise location information in the event of an error.

    wrapStateWithSingleton

    public void wrapStateWithSingleton()
    This method will change the state of this component to singleton.

    wrapStateWithPooling

    public void wrapStateWithPooling()
    This method will change the state of this component to pooling.

    wrapStateWithThreadLocal

    public void wrapStateWithThreadLocal()
    This method will change the state of this component to thread local.

    collectInstance

    public void collectInstance(java.lang.Object comp)
    This method should be used to return a component instance obtained via getInstance(). This method is primarily used for returning pooled components.
